      yes, but let's hope that global cooling might be real as well

9.23.19  9:26 am   Is time cyclical or linear? Or maybe it's some funky shape we haven't even thought of yet?

      time is linear in the context of a space. space is cyclical in the context of time

9.23.19  9:26 am   Do you think the earth is flat

      it's sort of an S curve

9.23.19  9:24 am   How do you become a successful musician without having knowledge about music itself?

      i think you would have to at least have some Experience in music itself, which is only going to turn into knowledge. experience is the ultimate knowledge. "it's like being there"

9.23.19  8:51 am   i want to do musical stuff like you, what program do you use for the art/ effects?

      textedit

      i've never been tested

9.23.19  8:36 am   please share a photo of your multi keyboard setup! (once the additional 2½ keyboards you ordered arrive)

      i will post it after it's done and after i'm out of rehab from it but it's gonna be way more, in fact there's no end in sight it seems

9.23.19  6:19 am   whats a good trick to finding music that has similar emotional/harmonic content to something particular you like, when most searches by association seem to be genre or artist based?

      impossible. you'll only see/hear it in context. try watching movies or videos. the movie may cause you to develop more of an attachmental bias to the music, but that's actually the way it's supposed to be. the music you liked before almost certainly came to you packaged in some way contextually. it's no accident that most people's favorite songs is something they heard in a movie, in a game, or while something was happening or while they were somewhere. you always are somewhere, that's just the law

9.23.19  6:17 am   what if you didnt filter out stuff for reality and instead released all? then your content with regards to your self documenting can be as efficient as possible. 1 hour of work (minus logistic time expenses) = 1 hour content.  I just recorded my first hour of thoughts (not trying to organize my thoughts but to think outloud entertainingly, entertaining myself pretty much and my thoughts, kinda the free form posts i can sometimes make here), and i keep thinking but can't really think of anyone who would be interested in listening to outloud thinking when its not for entertaining purposes. But I think maybe there might. Like, I turned on the mic and thought out loud it for 52 minutes and thinking of it being able to be as a standalone thing that's releasable. And I keep thinking but i think its maybe just a bit less tiring to do it without that extra minigame. Do you think that minigame should be the norm? that i should strive to be as entert aining/e fficient thoughtwise even when the mics off. Now if that were the case, wouldn't that make my aspiration to have every thought be content? Then how would I organize that, and when? I think maybe theres a benefit of only turning it on in certain times and be able to verbalize what has been inner dialogue only for a while, and that in itself can be an interesting display of words over time.
I'd like to invite you to be the first listener of the first outloud thought session. (the whole what the hell is a podcast thing rubbed off on me which is why ive avoided the word throughout this, i realize i have a similar thing with "philosophizing", its just thinking really, the proper way perhaps, although thats already adding a bit of my biases).

I think not thinking of it as a podcast would limit myself to thinking "you cant release 3 today!" If i felt like recording 3 outloud thought sessions in a day. because that doesn't fit my idea of what a podcast is, and that ma y bias the way i do what i do and how i do it or even worse, how i think of it.

Turns out i came here to ask about why not release unedited reality footage but i really just wanted to talk about my first time doing something that felt natural since I am still riding that high.

Hope you're having a bunch of fun and fulfilment playing around with your process and thanks for doing what you do and how you do it, i wouldnt be able to think doing whatever made sense if i didnt see you make sense of whatever you do.

I'd normally go back and add parenthesis to afterthoughts but ive learned its more pure when the words are chronologically put where they are.

     that's true

      Maybe not pure but characteristically something else.

     sounds like you are in for some very enjoyable times in the future. don't get too overwhelmed if everything seems to be its opposite on occasion

9.23.19  6:10 am   9.21.19  7:32 am -- Did U Know that MacOS uses Emacs shortcuts globally; and thus you can use ctrl-e to go to the end of a line (ctrl-a to go to the beginning)

     i had discovered that but fogotten. better for me at this stage would be to -- wait, interrupting myself here to inform you that ctrl A and E are the beginning and end of a Paragraph. command left right arrow still remains just the line, regardless of paragraph. what i wish i had, however, was skip to end/beginning of sentence. microsoft has had that for years, i think i'm gonna try to use regex to get it. i would use that every day on the questions page for those subanswers

      every

9.22.19  11:18 pm   What type of water is your favorite

      clean

9.22.19  11:15 pm   tips on getting nice snare rolls on midi drums? is it just a sound that certain instruments have or is it an arpeggiator trick? 

      your best bet for that would be to use some good samples, and then you can take control of the pitch, eq, etc and make it your own, and also of course tightly control the duration. and also have a wide variety of choices. the more options you can get in front of you, (different samples, different pitch, etc) the more likely you are to reach for that right one at the right time

9.22.19  11:13 pm   How do you come up with lyrics

      come up with the music at the same time

9.22.19  11:08 pm   Are you going to make a Christmas song next summer?

      that's a good idea

      linux

      sure

9.22.19  9:19 pm   9.21.19  1:36 pm

hmm. I think if god had to be created, than he wouldn't be god. The question "who created god" assumes that god had to be created. I think he would have to be outside of creation.

I don't think god is stuck in time, space, and matter, like we are.

Humans created computers but they are not bound by the rules that the computers are bound by, like ram, gb storage,etc. Humans are not stuck in the computer. They're outside of the computers. But even humans flaws. A god would be flawless.

The concept of a "god" is so difficult to even wrap around our head.

And if you do find out there is a god, the next question is, which one's the right one?

      everything about "the", "a", and "he", would all be extremely uncharacteristic of anything 'god'

9.22.19  7:40 pm   how some in soap tips when he's looking for love in the jungle he gets all pixelated for a second? was that intentional or was that an editing mistake?

      ha, i wish i had an easy way to pixelate back then. such a simple technique and yet seemingly was not available at that time. i did a lot of other weird shit but usually not pixelating, would require too many workaround steps. in the future, however, pixelation will be on convenient speed dial. i may pixelate the entire neighborhood on a whim
